Package server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.Server
  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    The Server class is used to create the server and accept incoming connections from clients. When a connection is made, the Server function will create a new thread to handle that client's requests.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Server​(int port)
      The Server constructor is assign a value to the PORT variable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void acceptClient()
      The acceptClient function is responsible for accepting new clients and adding them to the clientList.
      void broadcastClientList()
      The broadcastClientList function is used to send a list of all the users currently connected to the server to each client.
      void broadcastMessage​(org.json.simple.JSONObject json)
      The broadcastMessage function sends a message to all clients connected to the server.
      void deleteClientByName​(java.lang.String username)
      The deleteClientByName function removes a client from the server's list of clients.
      java.util.List<Client> getAllClients()
      The getAllClients function returns a list of all clients connected to the server.
      Client getClientByName​(java.lang.String username)
      The getClientByName function takes a String username as an argument and returns the Client object that has that username.
      void startServerSocket()
      The startServerSocket function creates a new ServerSocket object, which is used to accept incoming client connections.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server​(int port)
        The Server constructor is assign a value to the PORT variable.
        Parameters:
        port - Set the port number that the server will listen on

    • Method Detail

      • startServerSocket

        public void startServerSocket()
        The startServerSocket function creates a new ServerSocket object, which is used to accept incoming client connections. The function also calls the acceptClient function, which accepts incoming client connections and starts a new thread for each connection.

      • acceptClient

        public void acceptClient()
        The acceptClient function is responsible for accepting new clients and adding them to the clientList. It also sends a welcome message to the newly accepted client, as well as broadcasting a list of all connected users.

      • getAllClients

        public java.util.List<Client> getAllClients()
        The getAllClients function returns a list of all clients connected to the server.
        Returns:
        A list of all clients

      • getClientByName

        public Client getClientByName​(java.lang.String username)
        The getClientByName function takes a String username as an argument and returns the Client object that has that username.
        Parameters:
        username - Find the client in the list of clients by username
        Returns:
        A client if it exists, or null otherwise

      • deleteClientByName

        public void deleteClientByName​(java.lang.String username)
        The deleteClientByName function removes a client from the server's list of clients.
        Parameters:
        username - Find the client in the list by username

      • broadcastMessage

        public void broadcastMessage​(org.json.simple.JSONObject json)
        The broadcastMessage function sends a message to all clients connected to the server.
        Parameters:
        json - The message which will be send to all clients

      • broadcastClientList

        public void broadcastClientList()
        The broadcastClientList function is used to send a list of all the users currently connected to the server to each client. This function is called whenever a new user connects to the server.
